image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: Adelaide Crows star Izak Rankine breaks his silence on the homophobic slur he directed towards an opponent, saying the word he used is "harmful" and "hurtful", and has "no place in our game or our society".

title.children: AFL star will work to regain 'everyone's trust' after homophobic slur

image.altText: Janelle Cuthbertson ACL injury AFLW

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide has had five players recovering from knee reconstructions. The AFLW is just three rounds into the season, but has at least 15 players recovering from knee reconstructions.

title.children: Port Adelaide hit hard with five AFLW players recovering from ACL injuries

image.altText: Facebook photo of Adelaide man Glenn Holton.

props.synopsis: CCTV footage of events surrounding the alleged shooting murder of a man in Adelaide has been played to a Supreme Court jury, which also heard from witnesses who said they heard yelling and a loud bang before discovering the victim's body.

title.children: Neighbours heard screaming on night of alleged murder, court told

image.altText: SES volunteers in orange uniform stand next to a large dam in a green field with trees

props.synopsis: Residents in the Adelaide Hills town of Echunga are being warned about a leaking dam which the SES says is at risk of failing and could cause water to flood nearby properties.

title.children: Adelaide Hills dam at risk of failure prompts warning to residents

image.altText: A man in a baseball cap leans on a fence in front of a paddock, with cloudy blue skies behind.

props.synopsis: A family that sold SA land to the federal government for a nuclear waste dump has bought it back.

title.children: Farm family buys back land it sold for scrapped nuclear waste site

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: A man seen holding a placard depicting alleged police killer Dezi Freeman at an anti-immigration rally in Adelaide on Sunday has been arrested.

title.children: Man charged after displaying Dezi Freeman placard at anti-immigration rally

image.altText: An octagonal sign that reads "Serving Port Pirie" stands next to a country road.

props.synopsis: Volunteer numbers have continued to drop in regional areas and service clubs are feeling the impacts as the average age of their members continues to rise.

title.children: Service clubs struggling to deliver amid lack of volunteers

image.altText: Boxes of toys stacked into a small mountain inside a shed

props.synopsis: A man has been arrested for allegedly stealing $250,000 worth of Lego and toys from department stores across Adelaide in a bid to resell them online, police say.

title.children: Lego and toys worth $250,000 allegedly stolen from Adelaide stores

image.altText: Ben Griscti

props.synopsis: NBL player Ben Griscti fractured a vertebra after a backboard collapsed on him during training, before waiting more than 90 minutes for an ambulance to take him to a nearby hospital.

title.children: 90-minute wait for ambulance after backboard collapses on basketballer

image.altText: Close up of Troy Bell's face looking serious outdoors

props.synopsis: Independent MP Troy Bell has resigned from SA Parliament days after the Supreme Court dismissed his appeal against theft and fraud charges — but Mount Gambier will not have a by-election to replace him before the March state election.

title.children: SA MP Troy Bell resigns from parliament after failed appeal for fraud and theft offences

image.altText: A bearded older man wears an oxygen tube, holds a broken tile and a tile cutter next to a bonding glue in a room

props.synopsis: Under the careful tutelage of Albert "Doc" Todd, patients at a South Australian palliative care service are turning plain tables into colourful pieces of art.

title.children: Hospital art project helps 'leave a glow', palliative care patient says

image.altText: Fred Newman is sitting at a brown wooden table with his energy bill

props.synopsis: The South Australian government informed the ACCC after global energy giant ENGIE admitted to incorrectly telling a customer that power prices are set by the government.

title.children: Energy giant admits misleading customer about power prices

image.altText: A soy sauce container in the shape of a fish.

props.synopsis: South Australia has become the first state in Australia to ban fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers as it continues to phase out single-use plastics. The premier says the state is leading the way and he expects other states will follow.

title.children: Nation-first ban on fish-shaped plastic soy sauce containers begins in SA

image.altText: Trinity de Lance holds her arms above her to signal the end of her beam routine and looks to the side.

props.synopsis: A report by an international ethics body finds Gymnastics Australia breached the human rights of a 12-year-old girl who broke her back while training in excruciating pain.

title.children: Gymnastics Australia found to have breached rights of girl who broke back

image.altText: Two young boys with white paint stripes under their eyes stand among a crowd. A third pulls the arm of the boy in the middle

props.synopsis: Young Indonesians are taking to the streets to voice their anger at the government and police. This is how the protest turned into a riot.

title.children: Indonesia's 'TikTok generation' has become an anti-police resistance

image.altText: National Guard troops in camo fatigues stand shoulder to shoulder holding clear shields

props.synopsis: A judge has ruled the Trump administration "wilfully" ignored federal law when deploying National Guard forces during riots in Los Angeles earlier this year.

title.children: Trump illegally deployed National Guard to LA protests, rules judge

image.altText: A man with a white bandage around his head looks neutrally at the camera with green foliage behind him

props.synopsis: Rescuers are still working to try and find those trapped in the rubble of buildings scattered across the country's remote eastern provinces, as international aid trickles in.

title.children: Second quake hits Afghanistan after more than 1,400 people killed, Taliban says

image.altText: A bald man with a brown moustache looks at the camera while being handcuffed by police.

props.synopsis: Police charge three men arrested outside the Melbourne Magistrates' Court on Tuesday in relation to an alleged attack on a First Nations protest camp.

title.children: Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell charged over Camp Sovereignty attack

image.altText: Alex de Minaur smiles while holding tennis balls at the US Open.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur knows he needs a few things to go his way to push "all the way" at the grand slams, and he has finally caught some breaks in New York.

title.children: This year's US Open gives the Demon a chance at an exorcism

image.altText: A pair of hangs holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: The class action involves junior doctors who worked at the Royal Hobart Hospital and the Launceston General Hospital during the past six years.

title.children: Class action seeks to compensate junior doctors for 'excessive' overtime

image.altText: Sam with her small baby, smiling in a play area.

props.synopsis: Behind Australia's tug-of-war between office headquarters or working from home, a growing number of employers have found a middle ground, providing the best of both worlds for both their workers and their business.

title.children: Behind the work from home debate a quieter shift to shared offices is happening

image.altText: Composite image of six victims of jumping castle tragedy with school signage as background

props.synopsis: The mother of one of six children who died in the Tasmanian jumping castle tragedy says she is devastated by a group's attempt to "block" a beachside memorial. They argue the area is "a place for families to escape the hardships of life".

title.children: Beach no place for 'forced' reminder of jumping castle tragedy, group says

image.altText: A young man with blond hair, fair skin and blue eyes sitting at a table in a dinner suit.

props.synopsis: He is accused of raping four women and has been charged with 28 other crimes, including alleged acts of violence against ex-girlfriends.

title.children: Son of Norwegian crown princess faces trial over rape and assault allegations

image.altText: A woman wearing a silk green dress is stands in front of a crowd of photographers

props.synopsis: Ms Malle, who described herself in an interview with The New York Times as a "proud nepo baby", is the daughter of actor Candice Bergen and director Louis Malle.

title.children: Vogue names Chloe Malle as Anna Wintour's replacement at US edition

image.altText: A man behind the bar pouring a beer from a tap.

props.synopsis: As the manhunt continues for the gunman who allegedly killed two police officers in north-east Victoria, businesses are beginning to feel the impacts.

title.children: Businesses hit by manhunt for alleged Porepunkah gunman call for support

image.altText: Priya and Nades Murugappan stand in front of a body of water.

props.synopsis: The Nadesalingam family's immigration nightmare has been transformed into a work of theatre that will have its world premiere at Brisbane Festival.

title.children: This Aussie refugee family made headlines. Now their story is on stage

image.altText: Logo Open AI is in white on black phone screen in front of a white computer screen with words.

props.synopsis: California parents Matthew and Maria Raine allege ChatGPT provided their 16-year-old son with detailed suicide instructions and encouraged him to put his plans into action.

title.children: OpenAI to add parental controls after teen takes his own life

image.altText: A reef with colourful coral

props.synopsis: The Great Barrier Reef and Torres Strait have seen six bleaching events since 2016, including back-to-back events in 2016-17 and 2024-25.

title.children: Calls to address water quality after back-to-back reef bleaching events

image.altText: Two young people are seen looking solemn as they drive a car.

props.synopsis: While federal agents are patrolling Washington DC under US President Donald Trump's orders, they are also being closely monitored themselves.

title.children: The crew roaming Washington to 'bear witness' to a crime crackdown

image.altText: A battery in a burrito bowl

props.synopsis: A Queensland woman says she was left panicked and unable to sleep after discovering a button battery in her lunch from a popular takeaway food chain.

title.children: Battery found in Guzman Y Gomez burrito bowl, expert raises serious safety concerns

image.altText: A large group of people with donkeys and luggage surrounding them.

props.synopsis: The Sudan Liberation Movement/Army is appealing to the United Nations to help recover the bodies of victims from a deadly landslide that destroyed a village in the Marra Mountains.

title.children: Sudan landslide claims 1,000 lives, village 'completely levelled'

image.altText: A young  girl in a pilots uniform standing in front of float plane, holding blonde golden retriever puppy, who has tongue out

props.synopsis: A 15-year-old girl from the Northern Territory is looking to break a record, as the youngest female to fly around Australia solo. And her golden retriever puppy, Bella, will be joining her for the ride.

title.children: 15yo girl and her puppy embark on record-breaking flight around Australia

image.altText: A fireball erupts in a city crowded with cars and shops, man in forefront running, smoke in the sky.

props.synopsis: This latest attack from Israel is a "significant blow" to the Iran-backed rebel group. But how much has it actually weakened the Houthis?

title.children: Israel has killed 12 senior Houthi figures. Has this weakened the rebel group?

image.altText: A couple stand in front of the Grand Canyon

props.synopsis: A new administrator's report has revealed Traveldream paid another company to secure flights, accommodation and tours for customers, which has now gone into administration itself.

title.children: Travellers face heavy losses after agency and supplier go under
